reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Ch,V. on our recent long-weekend trip to Montreal. We found the hotel to be conveniently located on upscale Sherbrook St., steps from museums, restaurants and shopping.
reviews.title: Convenient, pleasant, clean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: Old Montral, Latin Quarter and Plateau are quite a bit farther but Its only a couple of blocks to the Metro.
reviews.title: Will always stay here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The Hotel is clean. Our room was not big but comfortable and was nicely equiped. Central heating didn't work (was turned off, according to the front desk) despite the fact that the overnight temprature was 3 Celsius.(Corridors were heated but not the rooms ?!) We were however promptly given a space heater and extra blankets. The bathroom was clean, high average
reviews.title: Great hotel for a weekend stay

likes.liked: — It's location and the beautiful room.
likes.disliked: — Too much bread and not enough protein at breakfast!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled solo
reviews.text: Breakfast consists of an average continental buffet, adequate though nothing exciting to write home about.
reviews.title: Dr. Jekyll & Mr. Hyde

likes.liked: — The politeness and friendliness of the staff
likes.disliked: — The hotel may be quite noisy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled on business
reviews.text: The staff was helpful and pleasant.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, central location, good price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled solo
reviews.text: Great location, older hotel with older plumbing, baths, etc. But very clean and comfortable. Great location on Sherbrooke Avenue with museums, galleries and great restaurant nearby. Sfaff very friendly and helpful. My room was small, ideal for one person. After leaving an upscale boutique hotel this would be considered modest, but one must consider that this is an older renovated establishment. Breakfast room very nice and sufficient internet facilities. Clean and comfortable and not fancy.
reviews.title: Comfortable, great location classic not elegant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would return alone again, but not to share with another person. The bathroom is too small.
reviews.title: Nice hotel; good staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the Chateau Versailles for 4 nights. I booked a "Deluxe" room after I read the other reviews on this site that mentioned poor room placement and noise associated with the standard rate rooms. While our room was nice, "Deluxe" is a bit of an overstatement. The room was still small and the bathroom smaller; I feel the only real benefit of booking a higher class room would be location. The staff was very pleasant and helpful; reccomeded several good restaurants in the area. The breakfast was outstanding- breads, fresh fruit, cheese, yogurt, cold cereals, etc. Very nicely done and well kept-up. The hotel's location is good; the metro station was a very short walk away as were lots of great restaurants and shops. All in all I would return and reccomed to others!
reviews.title: Simply Wonderful

likes.disliked: — it has a lot of stairs, but we didn't really mind that.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007
reviews.text: We felt Chateau Versailles was a beautiful hotel for our Montreal get-away. We were there for 5 nights, Friday-Tuesday. The staff is wonderfully polite and very helpful, as well as being fluently bilingual. The only snag we had is that the front desk ran out of key cards, so a porter showed us to our room where we waited for the bellman to bring our suitcases and the key cards up to us. Our room was comfortable and well decorated with a nice view of the neighborhood. We were two flights up, and had to climb stairs because there is no elevator, but we didn't mind that.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel in a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The location is excellent -- we were within walking distance of the fine arts museum and a number of restaurants and shops, and we were only three short blocks from a metro stop so it was easy to get to other places in the city as well. We heard a little noise from the street, but not much. They also had a business center that allowed us to keep in touch with the rest of the world via e-mail & the web for free.
reviews.title: wonderful hotel experience in lovely city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled solo
reviews.text: I just took my first-ever totally solo pleasure trip and chose Montreal and the Chateau Versailles. It was the perfect choice -- absolutely lovely and very comfortable. My room was very small, but as I was alone, this suited me fine. It was decorated in wonderfully rich colors and the linens were beautiful. The hotel staff was exceedingly helpful and polite -- front desk staffers, maids, breakfast attendant, bellmen -- all could not have been nicer. I also found the hotel's location to be ideal. It's on a main street, just two blocks from a Metro stop, but still relatively quiet. The breakfast was continental, meaning nothing fancy, but ample, very nicely presented, and tasty. The only slight issue I had was an occasional odd smell, almost like sweat, in the bathroom. I think I isolated it to the shower curtain, and I could have asked for a new one, but it wasn't a big deal. I would absolutely return to this hotel on my next trip to Montreal.
reviews.title: Lovely little hotel

likes.liked: — The staff and the overall cozy feeling.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just got back today after having a wonderful time in Montreal! I booked this hotel on Travelocity and got excellent deal. I don't know how we got it, but we paid far less than any other site I saw at the time or since then. It was a sweet deal! ($76 a night!).
reviews.title: Loved the Chateau!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So after reading the reviews, I was positive we'd get a room in the noisy first floor or worse in the basement! But au contraire! We arrived and were informed that we had been upgraded to a "delux" room with a king sized bed! It was a very nicely sized room, very quiet off the street. We really lucked out, I could see how the 1st floor rooms or those on the street could be noisy. Which could really affect your stay. Our room was very comfortable, well appointed and quaint. We really felt at home.
reviews.title: so charming!

likes.disliked: — slightly smoky smell upon entering room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast in the boudoir was a nice touch. It was nice to not have to worry about that meal. Croissants, nice fresh bread, fruit, cereal, hard boiled eggs. Nothing fancy, but a great start to the day.
reviews.title: Ok, but noisy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There's a sparse exercise room (a bike, treadmill, and a cable type home gym)... but who cares... you're on vacation right? There are 2 computers you can use to surf and print things. You might have to wait to get on. The hotel is a converted house so there's not a very large lobby or front desk, but it has most of what you'd need.
reviews.title: Don't stay on level 1

likes.disliked: — 1st floor rooms are in basement of building

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My girlfriend and I recently spent 4 nights at the Chateau Versailles in Montreal. To say we have a vast insight to the variety of rooms they offer would be an understatement. Upon checking into what we thought was a smoking room (as requested at booking) we were advised in no uncertain terms that the hotel does not have any smoking rooms and were therefore allocated a non-smoking room. We reluctantly accepted and checked into what was a rather nice boutique style room. The room was pastel in colour, of adequate size and with a funky art deco style bathroom.
reviews.title: Disaster diverted - Just!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The next morning i spoke with the very polite and helpful receptionist and asked if in fact there were any smoking rooms - we were advised that yes there were and happily accepted a transfer. (Quite why we were told there were no smoking rooms in the first place by the rather unhelpful girl on the front desk at check in is beyond me).
reviews.title: Cozy weekend at the Chateau Versailles

likes.disliked: — Shower size, noisy pipes, large stair case leading to front desk

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: As you can expect we were now happy to indulge in our filfthy habit and settled into our new room (as nice a standard as the previous one)
reviews.title: Boutique Hotel in out of the way location

likes.liked: — I had a really large bathroom. proximity to galleries and museum
likes.disliked: — Impersonal, small, there is better service in Montreal. Distance from Metro, difficulty in finding taxis.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upon returning to our room after a day exploring Montreal, we were shocked to discover that we could not open our doors. Upon consulation with firstly the front desk and then with the maintenance guys it turned out that the door lock had malfunctioned and we would therefore have to be relocated into the sister hotel (Le Meridien) across the street.
reviews.title: Satisfied!

likes.liked: — Location and charm of the hotel.
likes.disliked: — Small room, room not as clean as it could have been (i.e. stained window sheer, cobwebs in overhead light fixture).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After agreeing to do this the hotel then backtracked and advised we would still have to stay in the Chateau versailles and after a half hour delay we were found another room (3rd so far).
reviews.title: Better than expected
